question:
In context with the recent discussions about the status of an Overseas Citizen of India, consider the following statements:
  1. A person whose parent/ grandparent is/ has ever been a citizen of Bangladesh is not eligible for OCI status.
  2. An OCI card holder enjoys different benefits from a Person of Indian Origin/ PIO card holder.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: A person whose parent/ grandparent has ever been a citizen of Bangladesh is not eligible to become an OCI cardholder. The same is also applicable to a person with similar links to Pakistan. This is in accordance with the section 7A of the OCI Card Rules. Statement 2 is incorrect:    An OCI card holder enjoys the same benefits as a PIO card holder because these two had been merged in 2015. There only the OCI category at present. An OCI can become an Indian citizen after holding the status for 5 years.
